com.twilio.chat

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.twilio.chat.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable

    public final class Message
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
    Representation of a Chat Message object.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Message.Media
      Media object describes downloadable media inside chat message with type Message.Type.MEDIA.
      static class  Message.Options
      Used to construct new message before sending.
      static class  Message.Type
      Represents the type of message.
      static class  Message.UpdateReason
      Indicates reason for message update.

      • setAttributes

        public void setAttributes(org.json.JSONObject attributes,

        Set attributes associated with this message.

      • options

        public static Message.Options options()
        Options builder. Use for constructing new message options in Messages.sendMessage(com.twilio.chat.Message.Options, com.twilio.chat.CallbackListener<com.twilio.chat.Message>).
        Returns:
        New empty Options object. ```java Message.options() .withMedia(new FileInputStream("/path/to/Somefile.txt"), "text/plain") .withMediaFileName("file.txt"); ```

      • getType

        public Message.Type getType()
        Returns:
        message type. If message has media type then getMedia() shall return the descriptor for the attached media.

      • hasMedia

        public boolean hasMedia()
        Helper method to check if message has media type.
        Returns:
        true if message has type MEDIA, false otherwise. ```java if (message.hasMedia()) { Message.Media media = message.getMedia(); } ```

      • getMedia

        public Message.Media getMedia()
        Get media descriptor of an associated media attachment, if exists. If the message type is TEXT this method will return null.
        Returns:
        Media descriptor with all information about the media including the output stream to write it to. Or null if no media is available.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable
